programme.title: Motorsport F1 Grand Prix
programme.desc: The final race of the 2010 Formula One season takes place at the Yas Marina circuit in Abu Dhabi. The battle for the drivers' title has been one of the most competitive for years, with world champions Jenson Button, Lewis Hamilton and Fernando Alonso pushing hard against the Red Bulls of Sebastian Vettel and Mark Webber. The identity of this year's champion is likely to rest on today's result. Red Bull were the dominant force in last year's inaugural race on this circuit, clinching a one-two finish. Can Alonso or the two Britons prevent a repeat result?(n)

programme.title: Classics in Europe
programme.desc: We revisit the first leg of the 1984 European Cup semi-finals as Dundee United, playing in their first and only top flight European campaign, took on Roma at Tannadice Park.(n)

programme.title: Classics in Europe
programme.desc: We revisit the second leg of the 1981/82 European Cup second round between Liverpool and AZ Alkmaar. The first leg finished 2-2 thanks to goals from David Johnson and Sammy Lee.(n)

programme.title: Classics in Europe
programme.desc: We revisit the second leg of the 1983/84 European Cup second round as a star-studded Liverpool side faced Athletic Bilbao at the San Mames Stadium. A tight first leg finished 0-0.(n)

programme.title: Classics in Europe
programme.desc: With a 1-0 first leg deficit to overturn, a 38-year-old Alex Ferguson took his Aberdeen side to Anfield to face Liverpool in the second round of the 1980 European Cup.(n)

programme.title: Classics in Europe
programme.desc: We revisit the 1980 European Cup quarter-final first leg clash between Celtic and Real Madrid at Parkhead. The 67,000 tickets sold within days of going on sale earlier that year.(n)

programme.title: Classics in Europe
programme.desc: Brian Clough's Nottingham Forest hosted holders Liverpool, boasting the likes of Kenny Dalglish, in this enthralling European Cup first round clash from 1978 at the City Ground.(n)

programme.title: Classics in Europe
programme.desc: We revisit this thrilling third round second leg clash at Anfield between Bob Paisley's Liverpool and French champions Saint-Etienne, who led by a goal-to-nil from for first leg.(n)

programme.title: Global Goals
programme.desc: The very best goals from around the world in 2016/17, including the pick of Bas Dost's 34-goal haul for Sporting. Plus, efforts from Tim Cahill, Kostas Mitroglou and Ricky Miller.(n)

programme.title: Brasileirao
programme.desc: Corinthians and Flamengo clash in the Brazilian League at the Corinthians Arena. Undefeated league-leaders Corinthians have won 12 and drawn four of their opening 16 matches.(n)

programme.title: UEFA Europa League
programme.desc: Manchester United attempt to win the UEFA Europa League for the first time as they face Ajax in Stockholm. Victory will guarantee a Champions League place for Jose Mourinho's side.(n)

programme.title: UEFA Champions League
programme.desc: Real Madrid aim to become the first team to retain the UEFA Champions League trophy against Juventus in Cardiff. Juve have lost in the final six times - more than any other club.(n)

programme.desc: The final of the Jiangxi International Women's Tennis Open in Nanchang, China.(n)

programme.desc: The final of the Ericsson Open in Bastad, Sweden.(n)

programme.desc: Day one of the Bank of the West Classic in Stanford. Launched in 1971, this is the world's longest-running women's-only tournament.(n)

programme.title: The Clare Balding Show
programme.desc: This week Clare is joined by gold medal long jumper Greg Rutherford, former two-weight boxing world champion Carl Frampton and Martine Wright, a sitting volleyball player.(n)

programme.desc: Day one of the Bank of the West Classic in Stanford. Launched in 1971, this is the world's longest-running women's-only tournament.(n)

programme.title: Classic Premier League
programme.desc: We revisit the ill-tempered 1997/98 Premier League clash between Liverpool and Chelsea. Chelsea, managed by Ruud Gullit, had won just five of the last 54 visits to Anfield.(n)

programme.title: Classic Premier League
programme.desc: We revisit the 1998/99 Premier League thriller between Aston Villa and Liverpool at Villa Park. Gerard Houllier was chasing his first victory since taking charge of Liverpool.(n)

programme.title: Classic Premier League
programme.desc: We revisit the 1998/99 Premier League thriller between Manchester United and Leeds at Old Trafford. Leeds, spearheaded by Jimmy Floyd Hasselbaink, were on a six-match unbeaten run.(n)

programme.title: Classic Premier League
programme.desc: We revisit this goal-laden 1998/99 Premier League clash between Leicester and Manchester United. The visitors arrived with strike duo Andy Cole and Dwight Yorke on red-hot form.(n)

programme.title: Classic Premier League
programme.desc: We revisit the epic 1998/99 Premier League clash between Southampton and Middlesbrough. Boro featured Paul Gascoigne, who had joined the club earlier in the year from Rangers.(n)

programme.title: Classic Premier League
programme.desc: We revisit this five-goal 1999/00 Premier League epic between Bradford City and Watford. After back-to-back promotions, Graham Taylor's Hornets were facing a relegation battle.(n)

programme.title: Mobil 1: The Grid
programme.desc: In this week's show, Bentley get set for the Spa 24Hrs, Max Verstappen gives an insight into the Red Bull factory and Porsche open up about data acquisition.(n)

programme.title: DTM Review
